subject: Re: [junit] re: junit process dies when calling ant
msgSnippet: Jeff, It is good to know the main cause of the problem,  If you find the reference to the patch please let me know. -Dan ... __________________________________
messageBody:
Jeff, It is good to know the main cause of the
problem, If you find the reference to the patch
please let me know.

-Dan

--- Jeff Tulley <j_tulley@...> wrote:
> I'm not looking at the Ant source code at the
> moment,
> but I am pretty sure that Ant makes a System.exit
> call
> in their main.
>
> This came up a while back (last week?) on the Ant
> development list. Somebody had suggested a patch to
> make it not call System.exit if a certain flag is
> set.
> I do not know if the patch was accepted.
>
> You can also do the same steps that Ant's main does
> --
> building a project manually yourself, etc. I'd look
> up Ant's dev list archives and see if you can find
> this thread, somebody gave a quick code example on
> this.
>
>
-----------------------------------------------------
> > Date: Wed, 10 Dec 2003 17:42:17 -0000
> > From: "dantran" <dantran@...>
> > Subject: junit process dies when calling ant
> >
> >
> > Hello, I have a need to all an ant task in a JUnit
> > test method.
> >
> > Here is how I call ant with all proper setup.
> >
> > org.apache.tools.ant.Main.main(args);
> >
> > The ant call runs fine, but Junit process exits
> > right after ant call.
> >
> > JBuilder test runner shows the following message:
> >
> > error reading test process
> >
> > However other runners (text, swing) just die.
> >
> > Any suggestion?
> >
> > -Dan
>
>
> __________________________________
